description: From ambi- (prefix meaning ‘both’) +‎ Latin versiōnem (from versiō (“change, turning; version”), from vertō (“to turn; to turn around”), from Proto-Indo-European *wértti (“to be turning around”), from *wert- (“to rotate, turn”)), modelled after extroversion and introversion.

entries.meaning: (psychology) A personality trait having balanced characteristics of both extroversion and introversion.
